alert.note: Alert for Bonner; Boundary; Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 05 at 7:00AM MDT until August 05 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following counties, Bonner, Boundary and Shoshone. Portions of Washington, including the following counties, Chelan, Ferry, Okanogan, Pend Oreille and Stevens. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other flood-prone locations, especially burn scars. Some of the burned areas included in the Flash Flood Watch are the Russell Mountain, Ford Corkscrew, Walker Creek, Muckamuck, Cub Creek, Cedar Creek, 25 Mile, Red Apple, and Eagle Bluff burn scars * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Atmospheric conditions will favor slow moving thunderstorms capable of locally heavy rain Sunday and Monday. Steep terrain and burned areas of north central, northeast Washington, and northern Idaho will be particularly vulnerable to flash flooding. Runoff and excessive rain will be capable of producing rock and mud slides as well as debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
